Selected Answer: D
The answer is D, because both prefix (++a) and postfix (a++) operators kept its result.

E.g:
After the first println
System.out.println(a++ > 10 || ++b <= 21);

The value of a is 11, therefore by the time it reaches the fourth println, a++ would already be 12, not 11.

questions.question_text: Identify two valid data types for the operands of the addition (+) operator?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
'+' operator in java can be used to add numbers and concatenate strings. Following rules should be considered. Only numbers as operands then result will be a number. Only strings as operands then result will be a concatenated string.
so logically the answer is A (string) and C (numeric)
because it says valid data type, array is not a data type right?

Selected Answer: AC
A and C are the correct answer.

Selected Answer: AC
In Java, the addition operator + is used for adding numerical values or concatenating strings.
